Source.Name: vim
Source.Summary: Vi IMproved, an advanced text editor
Source.Description: Vim, which stands for Vi IMproved, is an open-source, multiplatform text editor extended from vi. It was first released by Bram Moolenaar in 1991. Since then, numerous features have been added to Vim, many of which are helpful in editing program source code.

Update.Comment: * Add official patches up to 138, changes can be read under offical/README * Enable ruby interface * Use buildtype for gui building * Simplify actions.py
Update.Name: Fatih Arslan

Update.Comment: Change vim runtime to the correct one. Vim73 should contain only runtime modules from vim itself.
Update.Name: Fatih Arslan

Update.Comment: * Tidy up vimrc, add comments to settings * j,k keys are now capable to move upward/downward in breaked lines * Offical upstream patches are included: * 7.3.080 spelling doesn't work on VMS * 7.3.081 non-printable characters in 'statusline' cause trouble * 7.3.082 leaking file descriptor when netbeans hostname doesn't exist * 7.3.083 when a read() or write() is interrupted by a signal it fails * 7.3.084 after window split the new one scrolls with cursor at top * 7.3.085 (after 7.3.083) inconsistency with preproc symbols * 7.3.086 v:count has value of previous command in expression mapping * 7.3.087 (after 7.3.083) missing include for errno.h
Update.Name: Fatih Arslan

Update.Comment: Offical upstream patched between *.062-*.079 are added: * 7.3.062 Python has problems when installed in an unusual directory * 7.3.063 Win32: Running a filter command makes Vim lose focus * 7.3.064 Win32: ":dis +" shows nothing, but "+p does insert text * 7.3.065 can't get current line number in a source file * 7.3.066 crash when changing to another window during :vimgrep command * 7.3.067 Ruby: Init_prelude is not always available * 7.3.068 using freed memory on ":saveas" if autocommand sets 'acd' * 7.3.069 GTK: pressing Enter in inputdialog() doesn't work like OK * 7.3.070 can set environment variables in the sandbox * 7.3.071 cursor binding not reset when editing another file * 7.3.072 can't complete file names while ignoring case * 7.3.073 double free memory when netbeans command follows DETACH * 7.3.074 can't use the "+ register like "* for yank and put * 7.3.075 (after 7.3.072) also use 'wildignorecase' in expand() * 7.3.076 Clang warnings for dead code * 7.3.077 when updating swapfile crypt fails there is no error message * 7.3.078 warning for unused variable * 7.3.079 duplicate lines in MSVC makefile
Update.Name: Fatih Arslan

Update.Comment: Update to patchlevel 160. Fixes lot memleak problems.
Update.Name: İnanç Yıldırgan

Update.Comment: *Update to patchlevel 100, *Fixed this problems; -Explanation about making a diff for extra_patches is unclear. -rename(from, to) deletes the file if "from" and "to" are not equal but still refer to the same file. -rename(from, to) doesn't work if "from" and "to" differ only in case on a system that ignores case in file names. -When deleting a fold that is specified with markers the cursor position may be wrong. Folds may not be displayed properly after a delete. Wrong fold may be deleted. -"killed" netbeans events are not handled correctly. -When typing a composing character just after starting completion may access memory before its allocation point. -Compiler warning for floating point overflow on VAX. -When 'ff' is "mac" then "ga" on a ^J shows 0x0d instead of 0x0a. -":tag" does not return to the right tag entry from the tag stack. -Recursive structures are not handled properly in Python vim.eval(). -Using ":diffget 1" in buffer 1 corrupts the text. -Adding URL to 'path' doesn't work to edit a file. -User command containing 0x80 in multi-byte character does not work properly. -":cs help" output is not aligned for some languages. -Some error messages are not translated. -Compiler warning for signed/unsigned compare. -With Visual selection, "r" and then CTRL-C Visual mode is stopped but the highlighting is not removed. -After ":number" the "Press Enter" message may be on the wrong screen, if switching screens for shell commands. -"!xterm" doesn't work when 'shell' is "bash". -Warning for signed/unsigned pointer. -Changing GUI options causes an unnecessary redraw when the GUI isn't active. -When using ":source" on a FIFO or something else that can't rewind the first three bytes are skipped.
Update.Name: İnanç Yıldırgan

Update.Comment: *Add translations.xml plugin, *Update to patchlevel 70, *Fixed this problems; -Can't create a funcref for an autoload function without loading the script first. -"[Scratch]" is not translated. -Warning for NULL argument of Perl_sys_init3(). -Screen update bug when repeating "~" on a Visual block and the last line doesn't change. -GTK GUI: the cursor disappears when doing ":vsp" and the Vim window is maximized. -It's not easy to see whether 'encoding' is a multi-byte encoding. -Session file can't load extra file when the path contains special characters. -Emacs tags file lines can be too long, resulting in an error message. -Compiler warning for storing size_t in int. -Crash when a function returns a:000.
Update.Name: İnanç Yıldırgan

Update.Comment: Add patch to fix segfault when adding XML comments (Fixes #8383)
Update.Name: Ozan Çağlayan

Update.Comment: *Update to patchlevel 60, *Fixed this problems: -In diff mode, when using two tabs, each with two diffed buffers, editing a buffer of the other tab messes up the diff. -When using winrestview() in a BufWinEnter autocommand the window is scrolled anyway. -VMS: Too many characters are escaped in filename and shell commands. -Crash because of STRCPY() being over protective of the destination size. -The Python interface has an empty entry in sys.path. -Wrong check for filling buffer with encoding. -Starting Vim with the -nb argument while it's not supported causes the other side to hang. -v:prevcount is changed too often. Counts are not multiplied when setting v:count. -Warnings for not checking return value of fwrite(). -Can't avoid 'wildignore' and 'suffixes' for glob() and globpath(). -synIDattr() doesn't support "sp" for special color. -Crash when using WorkShop command ":ws foo". -Compilation warnings for format in getchar.c. -Various compiler warnings with strict checking. -Combination of int and size_t may not work. -Can't add a patch name to the ":version" output. -Diff display is not always updated.
Update.Name: İnanç Yıldırgan

Update.Comment: Update to patchlevel 40 and revert kde-devel-vim plugin.
Update.Name: İnanç Yıldırgan

Update.Comment: Add highlighting fixes for grub.conf, xorg.conf, fstab and bash_completion scripts
Update.Name: Onur Küçük

Update.Comment: Taglist and kde-devel-vim plugin bump to lastest
Update.Name: İnanç Yıldırgan

Update.Comment: Update to patchlevel 15. Split package gvim and vim. Remove gtk2 dependency for vim. Add gvimtutor additional file.
Update.Name: İnanç Yıldırgan

Update.Comment: Fix arbitrary code execution issue with v_K and potentially K command.
Update.Name: Pınar Yanardağ

Update.Comment: Correctly detect failing diff. Symlink /bin/ex to /usr/bin/vim, gdb looks at /bin/ex.
Update.Name: Eren Türkay

Update.Comment: Fix actions.py and newPythonFile plugins conflict
Update.Name: Onur Küçük

Update.Comment: Fix kde vim ftp and some defaults in vimrc
Update.Name: Onur Küçük

Update.Comment: Default background color has changed in vimrc
Update.Name: A. Murat Eren

Update.Comment: Sync with upstream (somehow we still love you!)
Update.Name: S.Çağlar Onur

Update.Comment: Sync with upstream (we all love you!)
Update.Name: S.Çağlar Onur

Update.Comment: Cool vimrc enhancements by A. Murat Eren
Update.Name: Bahadır Kandemir

Update.Comment: Replaced sed operation with an echo. I love you ActionsAPI. Removed my name from actions.vim :)
Update.Name: Bahadır Kandemir

Update.Comment: Fixed wrong AdditionalFile path. Added missing m4 dependency.
Update.Name: Bahadır Kandemir

Update.Comment: Syntax highlight, nowrap, autoindent. These are now set by default. A. Murat Eren's actions.vim added to plugin list. Fixed broken vi link
Update.Name: Bahadır Kandemir
